etymologies: Old English spinel, from the base of the verb spin

definitions: a slender rounded rod with tapered ends used in hand spinning to twist and wind thread from a mass of wool or flax held on a distaff.
shortDefinitions: slender rounded rod with tapered ends used in hand spinning to twist and wind thread from mass of wool or flax

definitions: a pin or rod used on a spinning wheel to twist and wind the thread.
shortDefinitions: pin or rod used on spinning wheel to twist

definitions: a pin bearing the bobbin of a spinning machine.
shortDefinitions: pin bearing bobbin of spinning machine

definitions: a measure of length for yarn, equal to 15,120 yards (13,826 m) for cotton or 14,400 yards (13,167 m) for linen.
shortDefinitions: measure of length for yarn, equal to 15,120 yards 13,826 metres for cotton

definitions: a turned piece of wood used as a banister or chair leg.
shortDefinitions: turned piece of wood used as banister or chair leg

definitions: a pointed metal rod on a base, used to impale paper items for temporary filing.
a rod or pin serving as an axis that revolves or on which something revolves.
shortDefinitions: rod or pin serving as axis that revolves or on which something revolves

definitions: the vertical rod at the center of a record turntable which keeps the record in place during play.
shortDefinitions: vertical rod at centre of record turntable which keeps record in place during play

definitions: a slender mass of microtubules formed when a cell divides. At metaphase the chromosomes become attached to it by their centromeres before being pulled toward its ends.
shortDefinitions: slender mass of microtubules formed when cell divides

definitions: a shrub or small tree with slender toothed leaves and pink capsules containing bright orange seeds. The hard timber was formerly used for making spindles.

notes.text: Genus Euonymus, family Celastraceae: several species, in particular the Eurasian E. europaeus

shortDefinitions: Eurasian shrub or small tree with slender toothed leaves

definitions: impale (a piece of paper) on a metal spindle for temporary filing purposes

examples.text: do not fold, spindle, or mutilate

shortDefinitions: impale piece of paper on metal spindle for temporary filing purposes
